TopicTitle: International construction ISS in Kerbal orbit.

Articles.Content:
Why donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t we set up a joint project to recreate ISS in orbit around Kerbin.

My suggestion is that a few people who can create high quality addons may share responsibility for the creation of parts for the ISS. (Like other realistic mods, 64% of thereal size)

Now itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s that

Current version 0.1

DOWNLOAD in SPACEPORT

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/0-19-x-iss-space-station-pack-ver-0-03/

If youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re addon or mod maker , and you interested this, write here in this forum.

name: John Dow

segment make: Destiny and Columbus

TESTERS NOT NEED

We have supply ships Soyuz-U, Soyuz TMA, Progress-TM, Dragon Space Craft, Buran Shuttle (Instead of NASA Space Shuttle).

HereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s the list of current mods and their makers.

Members

How make KSS ISS segment.

1. Open any information about your segment. Calculate 64% of the dimension and mass.

2. Make model and port them into game.

2.1 For simple cylinder part use 24side (or less) mesh.

2.2 Use photo for create texture

2.3 Use very simply collider for your parts (12 side or lees for cylinder part, and just box collider for small or simply parts.

2.4 If your real segment have IVA or EVA hatch, make interior and EVA hatch.

3. Construction.

3.1 ISS now have 2 type dock port. Russian style docking port (already use in MIR addon) and NASA style (In the Pre-Alpha, has issues as of .04).

Edited July 2, 2013 by BobCat

This project came to my attention today, and it made my day. Unfortunately I am not a modder, so I cannot help with that aspect. But I would like to make a suggestion/request. If all docking ports could be compatible with Romfarer's docking cam mod, I would appreciate that. I did not see this mentioned on this forum before hand and was unsure if this was already mentioned.

Thanks, and if there is anyway I can help, as a non-modder, do not hesitate to ask.

This project came to my attention today, and it made my day. Unfortunately I am not a modder, so I cannot help with that aspect. But I would like to make a suggestion/request. If all docking ports could be compatible with Romfarer's docking cam mod, I would appreciate that. I did not see this mentioned on this forum before hand and was unsure if this was already mentioned.

Thanks, and if there is anyway I can help, as a non-modder, do not hesitate to ask.

Romfarer was part of this project, but then he became a dev, I'm not aware of his current state in the project, but you could ask him what his state is though, and if they are compatible.

To be honest, you probably don't need romfarer to make sure that all the docking ports are compatible with his docking cam mod. I did a simple test, I took a random docking part from spaceport that didn't have romfarers docking cam mod, added a single module of code, and then it had the docking cam. As long as the romfarer.dll is in the plugin folder, you just need to add a simple module, shorter than what I have typed in the first sentence of this post, to the part.cfg of the desired docking module. It took longer me to launch KSP that it did to implement this change.

A video demo of the JEM modules from the old thread.

@devogen: That's true , the arm is just animated.

Today after my first docking test with JEM modules, I encountered an issue I didn't think: It's impossible to dock 2 parts with exactly the same rotation. Here a pic that explain what I'm talking about:

____________________________________________________________________________PM_______________________ELM-PS___________________EF______________________ELM-ES

As you can see when I paly the animation, the payloads are deployed they're not in line with the EF, that's awful. To solve this issue, I found 2 ways:

1. Make the EF (and ELM-ES) be part of the PM module part, and make them "pop-up" with an animation.

Points for: Reduce part count, keep arm's animation deploying payload, less docking manoeuvers (I don't think docking these part is fun).

Points against: Not very realistic, PM module may be a heavy part with 3 animations (EF pop-up, ELM-ES pop-up, arm animation) and lot of vectrices.

2. Remove the payloads deployment animation from the PM part and make them "pop-up" with an animation in the EF part.

Points for: More realistic (??), keep 4 parts to dock (I don't know if it's really a good point)

Points against: Arm will only be animated to be placed in idle position (like in the screenshot), parts with multiple docking nodes (ELM-ES and PM) will need extra docking nodes parts that increase the part count.

I prefer the first solution but tell me your feelings or if you have a better idea.

Edited April 24, 2013 by Yogui87
